--- In archive-crawler@yahoogroups.com, Gordon Mohr <gojomo@...> wrote:
>
>=
 Are you sure you're using the same Sun Java on the 9.04 system as the

orking 8.10 system? 

Dear Gordon

Thanks for responding to me.  Yes, I'm s=
ure that I'm using the same Sun Java.  However, the oddest thing happened: =
 I just kept on beating my head against the same old stone wall - and event=
ually the harder (and less brittle) object won, and I just popped through t=
he wall.  I kept trying to run a crawl, and eventually SOMEHOW some script =
must have figured out where some resources were.  It just started working, =
and I cannot replicate the problem.

All the control functions started to w=
ork after my "magic hard-head breakthrough" and I don't have the faintest c=
lue as to WHY.  I'm guessing that some library function found where a neede=
d resource was hiding under 9.04.  Either that, or it was a combination of =
the phase of the moon, my zodiac sign and my father's shoe size.

All I kno=
w is it works, and now it won't fail.

Rich (the confused) Bowser
